results.title: The Duellists [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, David Puttnam and Ridley Scott
results.brief_description: In the early nineteenth century two officers in Napoleon’s army challenge each other to a duel. Their initial skirmish, which begins over a trivial insult, becomes a fierce and obsessive passion which dominates the lives of the men over thirty years. This beautifully photographed film is a penetrating study of the lunacy of war and the decay of the aristocratic class in Europe. The first feature by Ridley Scott, its ravishing imagery recalls the classicism of pictorial art of the period: the characters are framed in backgrounds that suggest Constable and Watteau. As the two men’s bitter feud enters its second decade, the images owe much to Turner and Delacroix. The rigid codes of pre-Napoleanic France are swept away by the romantic tide of revolution. With Harvey Keitel, Keith Carradine, Albert Finney and Tom Conti. Winner of Best Debut Film, Cannes, 1977. Based on Joseph Conrad’s short story. Also available on VHS [304321]

results.title: The Drunkard's reformation
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: An alcoholic father takes time to reflect when he, accompanied by his child, is confronted with a stage performance preaching the evils of drinking. Cast includes Arthur V. Johnson, Linda Arvidson, Adele DeGarde, Charles Avery, Florence Lawrence, Mack Sennett, Harry Solter. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: The Drug problem, what do you think?
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Stanley Croner and Eli Hollander
results.brief_description: Defines a drug as any chemical that alters normal biological functions and suggests that the advertising media promotes drug use. Stimulates discussion that will help students think realistically about the abuse of common drugs and the danger of buying street drugs.

results.title: The Drug bug
results.creator_credit: Animafilm, World Health Organisation and Horla Stefanesco
results.brief_description: An animated film on drug dependence, based on a La Fontaine fable. It shows how “speed” or amphetamines can begin by helping and end by hurting. The story revolves around the fate of a frog who must perform feats of daring to impress his girlfriend.

results.title: The Drover's wife: a short story by Henry Lawson
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Allan Ashbolt, Gian Manara and Henry Lawson
results.brief_description: A visual interpretation of the short story by Henry Lawson. The drover’s wife remembers incidents and habits of her life as she sits up all night waiting for a snake to come from its hiding place inside her house so she can kill it. Starring Clarissa Kaye, Mark Healey, William McCallum, Vicki Waller. Narrated by Allan Ashbolt.

results.title: The Drover's wife
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Sue Brooks
results.brief_description: The Australian myth of Russell Drysdale’s painting “The Drover’s Wife” retold from a different perspective. Based on a short story by Murray Bail. Cast includes Elaine Gay, Jeff Ashby and Martin Vaughan. (Awards: Winner of Rouben Mamoulian Award, Sydney Film Festival 1985)

results.title: The Drover's wife
results.brief_description: From Henry Lawson via Russell Drysdale - The Australian myth of The Drover’s Wife retold from a different perspective. Story retold by Murray Bail. Based on Henry Lawson’s original story and inspired by Drysdale’s painting of the same name this film explores women’s invisibility in our cultural history. What is so wonderful about this program is not only that it uses a wide variey of commentators and visual and literay sources, but it is positive and free of professional jargon. Cast features Martin Vaughan. Won Silver Award and Special Award for Acting in the General Category at the AFI Awards.

results.title: The Drover
results.brief_description: The romantic days of droving are recalled in this film which illustrates the day to day life led by the drover on a long and lonely trip in the great Australian outback.

results.title: The Dropout
results.creator_credit: Affiliated Film Producers, Irving Jacoby and Henwar Rodakiewicz
results.brief_description: Shows reasons for many youths leaving school without reaching leaving standard through dramatised typical cases. Causes are complex, including home background, attitude of parents, emphasis on possessions in a commercial society and pressure to achieve independence. Suggests ways in which schools can help by attention to those left behind and discouraged and shows courses emphasising practical subjects and preparation for work.
